1.definition: physical, emotional, or esp. economic harm or damage sustained

sub_terms.a: decrease in value, capital, or amount compare
sub_terms.b: an amount by which the cost of something (as goods or services) exceeds the selling price compare
sub_terms.c: something unintentionally destroyed or placed beyond recovery
sub_terms.d: the amount of an insured's financial detriment due to the occurrence of a stipulated event (as death, injury, destruction, or damage) in such a manner as to create liability in the insurer under the terms of the policy

1.note: As a general rule, economic losses are deductible from adjusted gross income under section 165 of the Internal Revenue Code. There are, however, numerous exceptions and limitations.

actual loss.definition: the identifiable and calculable monetary detriment that is suffered or will be suffered as a result of an act or event

actual total loss.definition: a loss in marine insurance in which the property (as a vessel or cargo) cannot be repaired or recovered comparein this entry

capital loss.definition: the amount by which the book value of a capital asset exceeds the amount realized from the sale or exchange of the asset

casualty loss.definition: loss of property as a result of a fire, storm, shipwreck, or other catastrophic event

consequential loss.definition: a loss that arises as an indirect result of an act or event called alsocomparein this entry

constructive total loss.definition: a loss in marine insurance in which the cost of repairing or recovering a ship or its cargo would be more than the ship or cargo is worth comparein this entry

direct loss.definition: a loss arising directly from an act or event comparein this entry

net op·er·at·ing loss.definition: the amount by which the expenses of operating a business exceed the income derived from it see also,

ordinary loss.definition: a loss from the sale or exchange of any asset that is not a capital asset

partial loss.definition: a loss arising from damage to property that does not render it a total loss

total loss.definition: a loss arising from damage to property that is so substantial as to make the property valueless to an insured

2.definition: the act or fact of suffering physical, emotional, or esp. economic harm or detriment
